All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Action
Base class for Actions.
ActionList
A thin wrapper for java.util.ArrayList<Action> that does not allow nulls to be added.
Actor
An entity that is alive by having hit points.
ActorLocationsIterator
Represents a bimap of locations and actors.
Application
The main class for the Mario World game.
AttackAction
Special Action for attacking other Actors.
AttackBehaviour
 
Behaviour
 
BuyItemAction
This class represents the action of buying (purchasable) items
CapabilitySet
A collection of Capability objects.
Capable
An interface for representing a collection of any kind of enum.
Coin
Class representing a coin of arbitrary value
Consumable
Interface for consumable items
ConsumeAction
The class representing the action of consuming a consumable item
DestroyShellAction
The class representing the action of destroying a Koopa's shell
Dirt
A class that represents bare dirt.
Display
Class that manages I/O for the system
DoNothingAction
An Action that doesn't do anything.
DropItemAction
Special Action that allows Actors to drop items.
Enemy
Class representing the enemies of the game
Exit
Class that represents a route from one Location to another.
FancyGroundFactory
Class that can create different types of Ground based on the character that represents it.
Floor
A class that represents the floor inside a building.
FollowBehaviour
A class that figures out a MoveAction that will move the actor one step closer to a target Actor.
GameMap
Class representing one map within the system.
Goomba
Class representing the Goomba enemy
Ground
Class representing terrain type
GroundFactory
Interface for factory classes used by GameMap to create new map locations.
HighGround
Base class for all high grounds
IntrinsicWeapon
Class that represents a weapon for an unarmed Actor (e.g.
Item
Abstract base class representing a physical object in the game world.
JumpAction
Class representing the action of jumping to HighGround
Koopa
Class representing the Koopa enemy
Location
Class representing a location in the game map.
Mature
Class representing a Mature Tree
Menu
A menu GUI implementations
MoveActorAction
An Action that moves the Actor.
NPC
 
NumberRange
A class that represents an array of sequential numbers.
PickupCoinAction
A class representing the action of picking up a coin
PickUpItemAction
Action to allow items to be picked up.
Player
Class representing the Player.
PowerStar
Class representing the Power Star item
Printable
Things that are Printable can appear in the user interface and therefore can be represented by a character in the UI.
Purchasable
Interface for items that are purchasable
ResetAction
Action to reset the game
ResetManager
A global Singleton manager that does soft-reset on the instances.
Resettable
 
Sapling
Class representing a Sapling
Sprout
Class representing a Sprout
Status
Use this enum class to give `buff` or `debuff`.
SuperMushroom
Class representing the Super Mushroom item
TalkAction
Action for talking between Actors.
Toad
Class representing Toad
Tree
Abstract class representing a Tree
Wall
Class representing a Wall
WalletManager
Singleton class representing the wallet system
WanderBehaviour
 
Weapon
Interface for weapon items.
WeaponItem
Class representing items that can be used as a weapon.
World
Class representing the game world, including the locations of all Actors, the player, and the playing grid.
Wrench
Class representing the Wrench item
